job_description:
Senior AI Engineer - Agentic Systems & Multi-Agent Orchestration

Company: TechFlow AI

About the Role:
We are seeking an exceptional Senior AI Engineer to join our platform team, focusing on building production-grade agentic systems and multi-agent orchestration frameworks. You will be responsible for designing, implementing, and scaling autonomous agent systems that leverage large language models to solve complex business problems.

Key Responsibilities:
- Design and implement multi-agent systems using frameworks like LangGraph, AutoGen, or CrewAI
- Build production-ready agentic workflows with proper error handling, state management, and observability
- Architect agent orchestration patterns including hierarchical, sequential, and parallel coordination strategies
- Integrate LLM APIs (OpenAI, Anthropic, etc.) into production systems with proper cost optimization and latency management
- Develop custom tools and function calling interfaces for agent capabilities
- Implement advanced prompting techniques including chain-of-thought, ReAct, and self-reflection patterns
- Build evaluation frameworks and monitoring systems for agentic behavior
- Collaborate with product teams to identify opportunities for autonomous agent deployment
- Mentor junior engineers on LLM integration and agent design patterns

Required Qualifications:
- 5+ years of software engineering experience with strong Python proficiency
- 2+ years of hands-on experience building production LLM-powered applications
- Deep understanding of agentic frameworks (LangGraph, LangChain, AutoGen, or similar)
- Proven track record of deploying multi-agent systems to production at scale
- Strong knowledge of prompt engineering, RAG patterns, and LLM optimization techniques
- Experience with distributed systems, async programming, and state management
- Familiarity with vector databases (Pinecone, Weaviate, Chroma) and semantic search
- Strong understanding of LLM APIs, token optimization, and cost management strategies
- Experience with observability tools for LLM applications (LangSmith, Weights & Biases, etc.)
- Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to debug complex agent behaviors

Nice to Have:
- Experience with agent evaluation frameworks and automated testing for LLM systems
- Knowledge of fine-tuning techniques and model customization
- Background in reinforcement learning or autonomous systems
- Contributions to open-source LLM/agent projects
- Experience with streaming responses and real-time agent interactions
- Understanding of AI safety, alignment, and responsible AI practices
- Experience with function calling, tool use, and external API integration patterns
- Knowledge of graph-based workflow orchestration and state machines

Technical Environment:
- Python 3.11+, FastAPI, Pydantic
- LangGraph, LangChain, OpenAI/Anthropic SDKs
- PostgreSQL, Redis, Vector databases
- Docker, Kubernetes, AWS/GCP
- GitHub Actions, monitoring and observability tools

What We Offer:
- Competitive compensation with equity
- Work on cutting-edge AI agent technology
- Collaborative team environment with top-tier engineers
- Flexible remote work options
- Professional development budget for conferences and courses

This role requires deep technical expertise in agentic AI systems and the ability to translate research concepts into production-ready implementations. You should be comfortable with ambiguity, rapid iteration, and the evolving landscape of LLM capabilities.
resume:
JORDAN MARTINEZ
AI/ML Engineer
Seattle, WA | jordan.martinez@email.com | github.com/jmartinez

PROFESSIONAL SUMMARY
AI/ML Engineer with 3.5 years of experience in machine learning and NLP applications. Background in building chatbots, recommendation systems, and working with large language models. Passionate about AI and eager to expand expertise in agentic systems and multi-agent frameworks.

WORK EXPERIENCE

AI/ML Engineer
SmartChat Solutions | Seattle, WA | March 2022 - Present

- Developed chatbot application using OpenAI API for customer service automation
- Integrated GPT-3.5 into existing product, handling conversation history and context management
- Built simple agent workflows for task routing and information retrieval
- Worked with LangChain for basic RAG implementation using company knowledge base
- Implemented prompt templates for different conversation scenarios
- Created API endpoints using Flask for chatbot integration
- Optimized token usage to reduce costs by implementing conversation summarization
- Collaborated with frontend team on chat interface and user experience

Software Engineer - ML Focus
TechStartup Inc. | Portland, OR | June 2021 - February 2022

- Built recommendation engine using collaborative filtering and content-based approaches
- Developed Python scripts for data processing and feature engineering
- Worked with ML models (scikit-learn, basic neural networks with TensorFlow)
- Created REST APIs using Flask for model serving
- Implemented caching with Redis to improve response times
- Wrote unit tests and participated in code reviews
- Deployed models to AWS EC2 instances

Junior Software Engineer
DevShop Co. | Remote | August 2020 - May 2021

- Developed backend features using Python and Django
- Worked with PostgreSQL databases and wrote SQL queries
- Built CRUD APIs for web applications
- Participated in agile development process and sprint planning
- Fixed bugs and improved code quality based on peer feedback

TECHNICAL SKILLS

Programming: Python (proficient), JavaScript (familiar), SQL
ML/AI: OpenAI API, LangChain (basic), scikit-learn, TensorFlow (basics), pandas, numpy
Web Frameworks: Flask, Django, FastAPI (learning)
Databases: PostgreSQL, Redis, basic MongoDB
Cloud: AWS (EC2, S3), some Docker experience
Tools: Git, Jupyter notebooks, VS Code, Postman
Concepts: REST APIs, basic system design, prompt engineering, RAG basics

EDUCATION

Bachelor of Science in Computer Science
University of Washington | 2016 - 2020
GPA: 3.4/4.0
Relevant coursework: Machine Learning, Algorithms, Databases, Software Engineering

PROJECTS & LEARNING

Personal Projects:
- Built a personal assistant chatbot using OpenAI API with memory and conversation context
- Experimented with LangChain for document Q&A using PDF files
- Created simple multi-step workflow for web scraping and summarization
- Built Chrome extension that summarizes articles using GPT API

Online Learning:
- Completed "LangChain for LLM Application Development" course on Deeplearning.AI
- Working through fast.ai courses on deep learning
- Regular reader of AI engineering blogs and newsletters
- Experimenting with new LLM models and techniques

ADDITIONAL INFORMATION

I'm really excited about the potential of autonomous agents and multi-agent systems. While most of my experience has been with simpler chatbot implementations and basic LLM integrations, I've been actively learning about more advanced agent frameworks like LangGraph and AutoGen through personal projects and online courses.

My experience with production systems is primarily at smaller scale - handling thousands of requests rather than millions. I'm comfortable with the fundamentals of API development, database design, and cloud deployment, but less experienced with complex distributed systems or advanced orchestration patterns.

I work best when I have clear requirements and can iterate based on feedback. I'm a quick learner and not afraid to dive into documentation or ask questions when facing unfamiliar challenges. I stay current with AI developments by following research papers and experimenting with new tools.

Areas I'm actively working to improve:
- Deeper understanding of LangGraph and complex agent orchestration
- More experience with vector databases and advanced RAG techniques
- Building larger-scale systems with proper monitoring and observability
- Advanced prompt engineering and evaluation frameworks
- System design for high-traffic applications

I have some experience with async Python but haven't built extensively asynchronous systems. My understanding of streaming LLM responses is mostly theoretical from tutorials. I've used function calling in toy projects but haven't implemented it in production at scale.

Looking for opportunities to work with experienced engineers who can mentor me in building production-grade agentic systems. Comfortable with remote work and flexible on travel for team meetings or training.

References available upon request.

Passion for AI and a clear career trajectory in AI/ML engineering, as indicated by the progression from Junior Software Engineer to AI/ML Engineer.
top_risks: Limited experience with multi-agent orchestration and complex coordination patterns, as there is no mention of production deployment or scale indicators for agentic systems.

Potential seniority mismatch, as the candidate's experience may not fully align with the senior level of the role.

Passion for AI and a clear career trajectory in AI/ML engineering, as indicated by the progression from Junior Software Engineer to AI/ML Engineer.
Experience with LLM integration and cost optimization in production systems
Some experience with multi-agent orchestration and task routing
top_risks: Limited experience with multi-agent orchestration and complex coordination patterns, as there is no mention of production deployment or scale indicators for agentic systems.
Lack of experience with advanced system design for high-traffic applications, as there is no specific mention of advanced system design techniques.
Potential seniority mismatch, as the candidate's experience may not fully align with the senior level of the role.
Limited evidence of deep production experience with multi-agent orchestration
Limited evidence of advanced system design patterns and scalability
